channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Graffiti sprayed on street box at Loughborough road SW9 6lh. The location is opposite the Jamm bar 261 Brixton road SW9 6Lh, 15th February
item.description:
I like to report graffiti sprayed on a green street box at Loughborough Road Brixton SW9 6LH. The box is Opposite the Jamm bar 261 Brixton road. The graffiti has been there for approximately three weeks. Unfortunately more graffiti has been sprayed further up Loughborough road. Please could it be removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Loughborough Road, Brixton, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous Pavement, 15th February
item.description:
Yesterday I had a nasty fall on the pavement adjacent to the Toby Carvery car park on Monks Way, Eden Park, Beckenham. We have lived in Eden Way for about 38 years and as long as we have lived in the area the pavement on this side of Monks Way has been a trip hazard. The main reason for this is that this pavement is covered in tarmac rather than paving stones. Ad hoc repairs have been done over the years resulting in a hazardous patchwork of tarmac of differing age, textures and of differing levels and gradients. Where I tripped yesterday there are two hazards nearby to one another and due to being in shock after the fall, I am uncertain which caused me to fall. One is a depressed area in the pavement that presents the hazard of potentially tripping over the rim of the depression; the other is a patch repair which is higher than the surrounding area thus presenting a trip hazard similar to a low speed hump on the road. Photographs of both these areas are attached. Also attached is a photograph of the injury I sustained as a result of this hazardous pavement. I am 77 in a month’s time so a fall such as this could have had life-changing consequences. It is lucky my hands/arms protected my face, but I had to have treatment at the Beckenham Beacon where they excised grit from the palms of my hands and treated a nasty cut. My neighbour, who is also in his 70s, is vision impaired and he too finds this area hazardous as do many of our neighbours in Eden Way. It is worth pointing out that whilst there are no actual addresses along Monks Way, it has a high footfall as residents of Eden Way need to use Monks Way in order to access the facilities in Upper Elmers End Road including bus and rail services.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Monks Way, Eden Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree limbs thrown over fence, 15th February
item.description:
This is not one of those “the tree grew over into my garden, so I’m throwing it back” things. Looks like the hose behind has dumped it over the fence after having some work done. It’s not really for me to say, but someone needs to have a word with the owner of the house. It not really acceptable behaviour.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clovelly Road, West Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree damage likely to fall, 15th February
item.description:
This willow tree is 5m from my home. Horses are eating the trunk potentially destabilising the tree, with risk of falling. Should the tree fall, heave, may effect my property. The trunk needs fencing around it to protect it from further damage. Furthermore should the tree fall it could hit my property causing damage.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Drive, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cabinet and rubbish dropped, 15th February
item.description:

It’s unsightly and is encouraging lots of additional litter to be put there. As well as litter in all of the bushes which should be cleared which has been there for over 6 months

item.title: Road drain is blocked (but not surface detritus), 15th February
item.description:
The road drain at this position regularly creates a huge lake covering the pavement and half the road and instead discharging the road water northwards down the private driveway to 25B, 27 and 27A (which water flow is damaging the tarmac surface).

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Orchard Road, Widmore, Greater London

item.title: Blocked drain / pondingv, 15th February
item.description:
What three words- ///ashes.most.exam This drain ponds when ever it rains and leads to the drain sinking. When I reported some 8+ years ago I was told there were roots in the pipes. And as such the same issue has continued. This also affect the drain on the other side of this junction. To confirm - two drains. Connecting pipe issues
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southborough Lane, Southborough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
